intro: Seseli libanotis subsp. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic scent. This subspecies is native to Japan and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
